nodes.text: Meiloorun Juice was a magenta-colored beverage made from meiloorun fruit. In 34 ABY, it was available at Ronto Roasters at Black Spire Outpost on the Outer Rim planet Batuu. The fruit juice was non-alcoholic and suitable for consumption by humans.

At the time of the First Order's arrival on Batuu, the Clawdite Remex Io was in Black Spire Outpost to meet with fellow members of the Kendoh Gang. 8D-J8, the droid who worked at Ronto Roasters, offered a Ronto Wrap to Io, but Io declined and requested Meiloruun Juice instead as it looked "safer." 8D-78 began to select a green beverage for Io, but due to the arrival of a First Order shuttle, Io fled and never received his drink.

A real-world version of this drink is sold in Ronto Roasters at Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. It was officially announced to the public on February 27, 2019 via articles on D23: The Official Disney Fan Club and StarWars.com, and was first pictured in the StarWars.com announcement. On April 24, Meiloorun Juice first appeared in the comic book Galaxy's Edge 1, where it was erroneously colored green. The beverage debuted for guests to purchase when the land opened in Disneyland Park and Disney's Hollywood Studios in 2019. The menu's description reads, "Pineapple Juice, Minute Maid® Lemonade, with Blueberry, Cranberry Juice, Lemon Juice, and Desert Pear."

The drink's inspiration is meiloorun fruit, first introduced to the new canon in the animated series Star Wars Rebels. The fruit itself originated in the Legends continuity with the 1996 novel X-Wing: Wedge's Gamble by Michael A. Stackpole.
